content.en: Yangmingshan National Park is in Taipei and New Taipei City. It's beautiful! It has many mountains. There are waterfalls and hot springs.
content.tw: 陽明山國家公園位於台北和新北市。它很美麗！它有許多山脈。有瀑布和溫泉。

content.en: There are flowers in the spring and summer. There's a musical flower clock. It has many kinds of flowers! Trees are everywhere. In autumn, some have red and gold leaves.
content.tw: 春季和夏季，公園繁花盛開。到了秋天，有紅色跟金色的落葉。

content.en: There are many things to do. You can hike. You can see great views! You can smell sulfur's bad egg smell!
content.tw: 你可以在公園裡健行，欣賞風景，還會聞到硫磺的味道。

content.en: You can visit the USA! You-- What? Oh, yeah! There's an American village in Yangmingshan! It has many old American houses. Some are now restaurants or cafes. And something fun is happening there now! It's a music festival called "Unplugged"!
content.tw: 在陽明山有個美國村，裡面有很多美式的老房子。大部分都變成餐廳或咖啡廳。而且現在正在舉辦音樂節!

content.en: The festival started with a traditional African drum show! And now you can listen to local bands and singers! You can sing in a contest! You can take dance classes!
content.tw: 這個音樂節從非洲傳統鼓開始。你可以聽到本地樂團和歌手的表演，也可以參加歌唱比賽或是上舞蹈課。

content.en: You can--oops, time's up! Hey! They're going to unplug my mic! Hey! Unplugged ends on September 10th. Go and listen to some great music. Have fun in the American village in Yangmingshan National Par-
content.tw: 哎呀，時間到了！嘿！他們要拔我的麥克風了！嘿！不插電音樂節在9月10日結束。去聽聽美妙的音樂吧。在陽明山國家公園的美國村玩得開心！

vocabulary.preface: 陽明山不插電音樂會每個周末都有，持續到九月十號。

content.text:
1. flower 花朵
I love flower festivals! They're so pretty. 我好喜歡花季，真漂亮!
Like the one on Yangmingshan? 就像陽明山花季嗎?
Exactly! There are azaleas and cherry blossoms.正是。他們有杜鵑跟櫻花。

2. mountain 山
I think Yangmingshan is a perfect mountain. 我覺得陽明山是一座完美的山。
Right, a very friendly mountain.沒錯，它很友善。

3. restaurant 餐廳
And there are many fine restaurants up there. 上面還有很多家好餐館。
Free-range chicken and bamboo soup, so nice! 放山雞跟竹筍湯，真好!

4. hot spring 溫泉
I especially enjoy the hot springs. 我尤其喜歡溫泉。
Oh, yes, how could I forget it? 對喔，我怎麼會忘了它?

vocabulary.postscript:
來讀單字。
flower花朵
mountain山
restaurant餐廳
hot spring溫泉

content.en: Hi, students! Have you ever heard of the phrase, "Busy as a bee?" If someone is "Busy as a Bee," it means he or she is really busy.
content.tw: 你們有聽過「跟蜜蜂一樣忙」這種講法嗎？意思是這個人非常忙。

content.en: Bees are busy insects. They go to many flowers and collect pollen. That's good for flowers. Bees also build hives. The hives are their homes. And, of course, bees make honey. That's good for us.
content.tw: 蜜蜂是很忙碌的昆蟲。他們要蒐集花粉，要蓋蜂窩，也就是他們的家。蜜蜂還會做蜂蜜！

content.en: Here's something you probably didn't know about bees. They like to play! Some people at a university in London proved that. They taught bees to roll small balls. How did the researchers teach the bees to roll little balls? They gave them food when they rolled the balls.
content.tw: 但你可能不知道，蜜蜂也喜歡玩耍！倫敦一所大學的研究人員教蜜蜂滾小球，只要蜜蜂滾動小球，就給牠們食物。

content.en: But the researchers found something else really interesting. They saw the bees playing with balls even when they didn't get food.
content.tw: 但是研究人員發現，就算沒有食物，蜜蜂還是會去玩球。

content.en: Researchers also found that younger bees played with the balls more than adult bees. Hey, that's just like humans. Kids like to play more than their parents, right?
content.tw: 他們還發現年輕的蜜蜂更愛玩球。跟人類很像，小孩也比大人愛玩！

content.en: One young bee played with a ball a 117 times. Wow - a 117 times! I guess that bee was having a ball. "Having a ball" means to have a good time. I hope you kids are having a ball, too, today!
content.tw: 一隻小蜜蜂玩球玩了117次。哇——117次！我想那隻蜜蜂玩得很開心。「玩得很開心」就是指過得愉快。我希望你們這些孩子今天也玩得很開心！

vocabulary.preface: 蜜蜂不是應該整天辛勤工作嗎? 但是有機會時牠們也會玩。

content.text: 1. hear 聽到。 I've never heard such a thing! 我從來沒有聽過這種事! What? 什麼事? Bees playing with balls? 蜜蜂會玩球嗎? Yeah, bees are insects. 對啊，蜜蜂是昆蟲。 They make honey. 牠們製造蜂蜜。 They don't play.
2. mean 意思。 You mean insects don't know how to have fun? 你的意思是昆蟲不懂怎麼玩? Right. They must think the ball is food. 對。牠們一定以為球是吃的東西。
3. food 食物。 No, their food is pollen.不對，牠們的食物是花粉。 Well, to a young bee, balls probably look like pollen. 對小蜜蜂來說，球可能看起來像花粉。
4. prove 證明。 You can't prove that. 你沒辦法證明。 You're right. I can't. I wish I were a bee.

vocabulary.postscript: 來讀讀今天的單字。 hear聽到 mean意思 food食物 prove證明

2. What is true about young bees?
options: A: They like to play more than adults.
B: They don't like to play much.
C: They like to play as much as adults do.

content.en: Hi students! Today I'm gonna start with a joke … are you ready?
Why can't elephants use computers?
Because they are afraid of the mouse!
Do you get it?
content.tw: 你懂嗎？

content.en: "Mouse" has two meanings. It can mean a small animal, but it also means a computer mouse!
content.tw: Mouse 有兩個意思，老鼠跟滑鼠！

content.en: If you are a human, you should be able to understand that joke. But for a robot, a joke like that is super hard to understand!
content.tw: 我們人類聽得懂笑話，但是機器人可能很難聽懂。

content.en: In the future, scientists say people will use robots for many things. Robots will even be our friends and help take care of us.
So, scientists are teaching robots how to laugh - at the right things!
content.tw: 現在，科學家在教機器人怎麼笑，還有甚麼時候可以笑！

content.en: This isn't easy! But scientists say that one-day robots will be able to learn to laugh at the right time and that robots will be able to have fun, funny, and interesting conversations with people.
content.tw: 但是科學家說，有一天機器人會學會笑，也可以跟人類聊有趣、好玩的東西！

content.en: Ok, before we go: one last joke: What kind of witch likes to go to the beach? A SAND-wich!! Get it? Witches and sandwiches are completely different, but they both have the same sound at the end - so that's why the joke is funny. A 'sand' witch! Do you think a robot could understand the Sand-wich joke? Hmmm…maybe not now…but one day they will!
content.tw: 好的，在我們離開前：最後一個笑話：什麼樣的巫婆喜歡去海灘？一個「三明治」(A SAND-wich)！懂了嗎？巫婆和三明治完全不同，但它們結尾的發音相同——所以這就是為什麼這個笑話很有趣。一個「沙」巫婆！你認為機器人能理解這個三明治笑話嗎？嗯……也許現在還不行……但有一天他們會的！

vocabulary.preface: 能夠聽懂笑話並且還會講笑話，這樣的機器人可有趣了。

content.text:
1. joke 笑話.
I want a robot that can tell jokes. 我想要個會講笑話的機器人.
Then I won't feel bored all the time.這樣我就不會總是覺得無聊.
I can tell you jokes. 我可以講給你聽.

2. understand 了解.
I also want my robot to understand my jokes. 我也想要機器人聽懂我的笑話.
That would be hard.這就有點難了.
Even I don't get your jokes sometimes. 連我有時候都聽不懂你的笑話

3. laugh 笑.
You don't have to. 你不用懂啊.
You just laugh.你只要笑就好了.
Yeah, maybe I'll laugh at you. 好，也許我就嘲笑你.

4. take care of 照顧.
Could you take care of my dogs for one day? 你能幫我照顧狗狗一天嗎?
Sure. 當然.

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like to tell jokes?
joke笑話
understand了解
laugh笑
take care of照顧

options: A: Because words have many different meanings

content.en: Mushrooms are part of a group of amazing living things that are not really an animal and not really a plant.
content.tw: 香菇不是動物也不是植物，它們是菇類！

content.en: You can eat some mushrooms, and they're super yummy. But you can also make leather from them.
content.tw: 它們不只很好吃，還可以做成皮革！

content.en: We use leather for many things. I have a leather belt and leather shoes.
content.tw: 皮革可以做成很多東西，像是我自己有皮帶或跟皮鞋。

content.en: But some people say we should try to stop making things with leather.
content.tw: 有人說我們不應該再用皮革做東西。

content.en: Why? Well, two big reasons …
content.tw: 為什麼呢？有兩大原因…

content.en: One, to make leather you need a lot of chemicals. Those chemicals can be bad for people, and they are bad for the earth - they cause pollution.
content.tw: 第一個原因是，做皮革要用很多化學藥劑，對人跟地球都不好。

content.en: And number two: Leather comes from animals - mostly cows. Many people think we need to stop eating so much meat and stop using things made from animals.
content.tw: 第二個原因是，很多皮革都是用牛做的。有人覺得我們不要再吃這麼多肉，也不要再用動物做東西！

content.en: That's why scientists are making leather from mushrooms! It looks almost exactly like leather from animals, and it's strong too.
content.tw: 所以科學家要用菇類做皮革！它很像用動物做的皮革，也是很堅固！

content.en: Using mushroom leather means we can say goodbye to bad chemicals, and it means we don't need to use animals.
content.tw: 這樣子我們可以遠離化學藥劑，也不用動物做東西。

content.en: Many companies are interested in this new mushroom leather.
content.tw: 許多公司都對這種新的蘑菇皮革很感興趣。

vocabulary.preface: 生活中有哪些東西是皮革做的，你可知道?

content.text: 1. leather 皮革。I don't wear leather shoes any more.我不再穿皮鞋了。Why not? 為什麼不呢?Because I'm wearing cotton shoes now. 因為我現在都穿棉布鞋。They are light and comfortable. 它們很輕，又很舒服。
2. strong 堅固耐用。But they are not as strong as leather. 但是它們沒有皮革堅固。That's true. So I don't wear them on rainy days. 這是真的，所以我雨天不穿。
3. use 使用。You use cotton for your bags too? 你也用棉布做包包嗎?Yeah, look at my book bag. 對啊，你看我的書包。Very cute! 很可愛呢!Yeah, I use cotton for many things. 我用棉布做很多東西。
4. company 公司。A lot of companies are making these products. 很多公司也在做這些產品I know. But I prefer to do it myself. 我知道，不過我喜歡自己動手。

vocabulary.postscript: 這些字簡單好用，來一起讀一遍。leather皮革strong堅固耐用use使用company公司

content.en: Hi, students! Do you play sports like basketball? Or maybe you like to play baseball, tennis, or bowling.
content.tw: 你喜歡打籃球、棒球、網球，或保齡球嗎？

content.en: If you do like to play sports, I have good news for you! Playing sports makes people tougher. It also makes them try harder. And it makes them braver.
content.tw: 運動可以讓人更堅強、更勇敢！

content.en: How do I know that? Well, some scientists at an American university told us. First, they asked people about themselves. They asked them some questions to see if they are hard workers. They also asked them if they are brave and if they easily give up.
content.tw: 美國科學家問了一些人覺得自己有多用功、有多勇敢、多不容易放棄。

content.en: Then, the scientists looked at the answers to see which people were tough. After that, they asked them if they play sports. They found that people who play sports are tougher than those who don't play sports.
content.tw: 他們發現有在運動的人比沒有運動的人還更堅強。

content.en: Some people think sports aren't important. But, now you know they are! Sure, sports help you to be healthy. But they also help you to be tougher and braver. And they make you more hard-working. If you play sports, you won't give up easily. All of that is important in life.
content.tw: 運動不只讓你更健康，也讓你更勇敢、認真，這些在生活中都很重要。

content.en: So, I think sports could help you be more successful in life, too!
content.tw: 所以，我認為運動也能幫助你在生活中取得更大的成功！

vocabulary.preface: 運動，特別是比賽型的運動，好處多多!

content.text:
1. work hard 努力工作。
It's late.很晚了。
I know, but I have to get this done. 我知道，但是我一定要把這個做完。
You work too hard. 你太用力工作了。

2. give up 放棄。
No, I just don't want to give up. 不是，我只是不想放棄。
But you've got to know when to stop. 但是你得知道什麼時候要叫停

3. Brave 勇敢的，braver 更勇敢。
Playing basketball makes me braver.打籃球讓我更勇敢。
How so? 為什麼呢?
I can push and shove other people. 我可以推擠別人。
That's not being brave! 那不是勇敢。

4. ask 詢問。
Where are we now? 我們現在在哪裡?
I have no idea.我不知道。
Let's ask that woman.我們來問問那位女士。

vocabulary.postscript: So what kind of sports do you like? 來讀讀單字。Brave勇敢的 braver更勇敢 work hard努力工作 give up放棄 ask詢問

options: a. The hardest sport to play
b. How sports make people tough
c. Why people like to play sports

What does give up mean?

content.en: Summers in Taiwan can be very hot! When the sun comes out, everyone feels warm. And sometimes, it's too dry. Isn't there any way to make it rain?!
content.tw: 台灣的夏天很熱，有時候也很乾！有沒有甚麼方法可以讓天空下雨呢？

content.en: In the past, we could not change the weather. But scientists have had an idea. They have found a way to make it rain, using electricity.
content.tw: 現在，科學家發現一種用電讓天空下雨的方法。

content.en: We know where rain comes from. It falls from clouds in the sky.
content.tw: 我們知道雨水是從天上的雲落下來。

content.en: Clouds are made of water. When the water gets too heavy, the clouds start to rain.
content.tw: 雲是水構成的，當這些水太重，就會開始下雨。

content.en: Sometimes there is not enough rain. That is not good. When the rain is too little, people have no water to drink, and plants become too dry. So how can we make it rain more?
content.tw: 如果雨水太少，我們就會沒有水喝，植物也會乾枯。

content.en: Recently, scientists did a test. They used a little robot to zap a cloud with electricity. (SFX: electric zap) The electricity made the drops of water stick together.
content.tw: 科學家做了一個實驗，他們電擊一朵雲，讓雲層中的水滴黏在一起。

content.en: When the drops of water come together, they get heavier. Then they fall to earth. So when the cloud is zapped with electricity, it turns into rain.
content.tw: 水結成大水滴之後會變得更重，然後變成雨，落到地面。

content.en: What a useful idea. Scientists think it can help people. When the weather is too hot or dry, people can use this technology to make rain. (SFX: heavy rain) All it takes is a cloud and a little electricity.
content.tw: 這真是個有用的想法。科學家認為這能幫助人們。當天氣太熱或太乾時，人們可以使用這項技術來造雨。(音效: 大雨) 所需要的只是一朵雲和一點點電力。

vocabulary.preface: 給雲層通上電，就有可能製造出雨水。

content.text:
1. cloud 雲。
How's the weather? 天氣怎麼樣?
A gray sky with lots of thick clouds. 灰色天空，有很多厚厚的雲。
Uh oh, that doesn't sound good. 糟糕，聽起來很不好。
No. I think it's going to rain very soon. 是不好，我想很快就會下雨。

2. rain 下雨。
It rained all day yesterday. 昨天就下了一整天的雨。
But it's better than a hot and dry day. 但是總比又熱又乾好。
I prefer a dry day. 我比較喜歡乾燥的天氣。

3. electricity 電力。
What's happening? 怎麼回事?
The light won't come on. 電燈不亮。
Because there's no electricity. 因為停電了。

4. in the past 從前。
What should we do? 我們怎麼辦?
In the past we would light candles. 以前我們會點蠟燭。
No, I don't want to stay here. 不了，我不要待在這裡。

vocabulary.postscript:
一起來讀讀單字吧。
cloud雲
rain下雨
electricity電力
in the past從前

When do clouds become rain?
options: A: When they get too heavy
B: When they get too light
C: When they get too sad

title: A Short Walk Can Keep You Healthy

content.en: What do you usually do after you eat? Sit down and read a book? Or maybe you take a short nap. Well guess what? Doctors say taking a short walk after eating helps your body control your blood sugar.
content.tw: 醫生說，吃飽後走走路可以降低血糖。

content.en: When most people think about sugar, they think about candy or ice cream or cake. -Sweet things have lots of sugar in them, right? Well, actually, many foods have sugar in them. There is sugar in milk, in tomatoes, in carrots, and even in onions!
content.tw: 不只是糖果蛋糕，牛奶、番茄、紅蘿蔔，還有洋蔥裡面也有糖！

content.en: Sugar from food gives us energy. We need sugar. But, too much sugar can be bad for our blood.
content.tw: 我們需要糖分，但太多糖對身體不好。

content.en: Too much sugar in your blood can give you diabetes.
content.tw: "Diabetes" 就是糖尿病，太多糖很容易造成糖尿病。

content.en: Doctors say people should take a short walk after eating, because it will help control their blood sugar. Doctors say you only need a short walk, it could be only 2 minutes! Just 2 minutes of walking around after you eat can help you stay healthy.
content.tw: 醫生說，只要吃飽後走兩分鐘就可以控制血糖，保持健康！

content.en: I think I'm going to try it! I'm going to take a 2-minute walk after I finish my lunch today!
content.tw: 我想我會試試看！我今天午餐後會去走個兩分鐘！

vocabulary.preface: 醫生說吃飽了不要坐著，要走一走。

content.text:
1. control 控制。
I'd love to walk around after lunch. 我很樂意吃過午飯後走走。
But sometimes I can't control work. 但有時候我沒辦法控制工作。
I can't control my life. 我還沒辦法控制人生呢。

2. minute 分鐘。
Besides, it only takes 2 minutes.
Right, I can at least stand up for 2 minutes.

3. blood 血液。
What did your doctor say?
He will take my blood first.
And run some tests.

4. healthy 健康的。
Don't worry. You're strong and healthy.
I'm only worried if I can still climb Jade Mountain.
我只擔心是否還能去爬玉山。

vocabulary.postscript:
So let's get up and walk! 來讀讀單字。
control控制
minute分鐘
blood血液
healthy健康的

options: B: Swimming in Sun Moon Lake

quiz.question: 2. What does sugar do for our body?
3. How long do you need to walk after eating?

title: Bird Spikes Help Birds Make More Birds

content.en: Birds are beautiful in the sky! They have beautiful colors! They make beautiful songs!
content.tw: 天上的鳥很漂亮! 牠們的叫聲也很優美!

content.en: Many birds live in cities. And every year, they make a nest. But some people don't like birds. Why?
content.tw: 很多鳥類都會在城市築巢，但有一些人不喜歡牠們。為甚麼呢?

content.en: Well, birds are loud in the morning and at night. And they make places dirty.
content.tw: 嗯，鳥兒在早上和晚上都很吵。而且牠們會把地方弄髒。

content.en: People keep birds away with bird spikes. A spike is long and thin. The spike end is sharp. OUCH!
content.tw: 人們用長而細的防鳥刺趕走鳥類，哎喔! 那些刺很尖銳。

content.en: People put bird spikes on top of walls and buildings. Birds can't sit on spikes. They can't make nests on them.
content.tw: 人們在牆壁和屋頂上放防鳥刺，鳥類就不會在上面築巢。

content.en: Crows and magpies are strong birds. Some of these birds take spikes! They like shiny things. Metal spikes are shiny.
content.tw: 烏鴉和喜鵲是強壯的鳥類。其中一些鳥會拿走尖刺！牠們喜歡閃亮的東西。金屬尖刺很閃亮。

content.en: But, that's not why they take them. Crows and magpies are smart. Scientists say the birds use the spikes. They put the sharp ends outside their nests. These bird spikes stop other birds and animals.
content.tw: 但是這不是烏鴉和喜鵲叼走的原因。牠們很聰明，會用防鳥刺築巢，阻止其他鳥類和動物靠近。

content.en: Taiwan has crows and magpies. They're strong and smart. Maybe you'll see a nest with spikes one day!
content.tw: 台灣有烏鴉和喜鵲。牠們既強壯又聰明。也許有一天你會看到一個帶有尖刺的鳥巢！

vocabulary.preface: 這些喜鵲自己不怕尖刺，有夠神奇!

content.text:
1. in the morning 在早上
I really need a vacation! 我真的需要度假!
I'd like to hear birds in the morning, and frogs at night.
我想要早上聽到鳥鳴，晚上聽到青蛙叫。

2. on top of 在上面。
Where can you find a place like that? 你哪裡可以找到那種地方?
A homestay in Taitung, perhaps. 也許台東的一家民宿吧?
I stayed one before. Next to the cafe?, on top of the hill.

3. smart 聰明的
You can just sit in a cafe here and listen to birds and frogs on your cell
phone. 你可以就坐在這裡的咖啡館，聽手機上的鳥叫青蛙叫。
That's a smart idea, you know. 真是聰明主意呢。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字和片語都很好用喔。
In the morning在早上
on top of在上面。
smart聰明的

quiz.question: 1. Why don't some people like birds?
2. Why do some people use bird spikes?
3. What birds use bird spikes?

content.en: Scientists say climate change is making this year hot. This July was the planet's hottest month in 120,000 years!
content.tw: 科學家說氣候改變讓今年變得很熱，今年七月是地球12萬年來最熱的月份!

content.en: Cactuses like hot weather. They don't need much water. They live in deserts. Deserts are hot and dry.
content.tw: 仙人掌喜歡熱的天氣，也不需要很多水分，它們長在沙漠裡。

content.en: Phoenix is a city in a desert. This July, Phoenix was the hottest city in the USA. Phoenix was very hot in August and it's hot now in September too.
content.tw: 今年七月鳳凰城是美國最熱的城市，八月和九月的天氣也非常炎熱。

content.en: Phoenix has many saguaro cactuses. Some are 12 meters tall! They have branches called arms. These cactuses can live for 200 years!
content.tw: 鳳凰城有很多巨人柱，這種仙人掌可以長到12公尺高，它們還可以活兩百年!

content.en: But in Phoenix, saguaro cactuses are getting sick! They're turning yellow. Their arms are falling off! Some cactuses are falling down!
content.tw: 但是鳳凰城的巨人柱生病了! 它們開始變黃，也開始倒塌。

content.en: People worry about their sick saguaro cactuses. What do these cactuses need? They need water! The cactuses can't stand the heat!
content.tw: 連仙人掌都熱得受不了!它們需要水!

content.en: Heavy rain comes to Phoenix every year. People hope the rain can save the cactuses. But can it?
content.tw: 鳳凰城每一年都會下大雨，人們希望這些雨可以拯救仙人掌。

content.en: It's too hot for cactuses! Now we need to do more than hope. We need to fight climate change together. We need to save the planet!
content.tw: 天氣太熱，連仙人掌都受不了！現在我們需要做的，不僅僅是希望。我們需要一起對抗氣候變遷。我們需要拯救地球！

vocabulary.preface: 天氣太熱，連沙漠植物仙人掌都快活不下去了。

content.text:
1. fall 掉落
I'm going to try riding a unicycle tomorrow. 我明天要試著騎獨輪車。
What? You'll fall off and hurt yourself.什麼啊，你會掉下來受傷。

2. arm 手臂
No, I won't. I'm good at riding a bike. 才不會，我很會騎腳踏車的。
A unicycle is different. 獨輪車不一樣。
You need to stretch out your arms. 你的手臂要伸出去。

3. hottest 最熱的
Wouldn't that be fun? 那不是很好玩?
You just like to do crazy things. 你就是喜歡瘋狂的事。Remember when you ate chili in the hottest weather? 你記得你在天氣最熱的時候吃辣椒吧?

4. water 水
Yeah, my tongue felt like it was burning! 記得，我的舌頭好像燒起來了。
I had to drink tons of water. 不得不喝大量的水。

vocabulary.postscript:
我們來讀今天的單字。
fall掉落
arm手臂
hottest最熱的
water水

quiz.question: 1. When was the planet's hottest month in 120,000 years?
What is Phoenix?
options: b. A city in a desert

quiz.question: What do the sick cactuses need?

title: This Shop Turns Into a Turtle Tunnel

content.en: Many turtles live in a pond. There's a busy street next to the pond. Every summer, female turtles cross the street.
content.tw: 池塘裡住著很多烏龜，旁邊有一條繁忙的馬路。每一年夏天，母龜都會穿越這條馬路。

content.en: There's a shop across the street. Some turtles walk into the shop. What?! Why?
content.tw: 街道對面有一間店，這些烏龜會爬進店裡。

content.en: They want to go to a wet, grassy marsh. It's great for turtle nests. It's behind the shop.
content.tw: 因為那間店的後方有一片沼澤，適合烏龜棲息。

content.en: The shop workers are kind. They open the front door and back door all day. The shop turns into a turtle tunnel! The turtles in the shop can walk to the marsh.
content.tw: 店員會把前後門打開，讓這些烏龜能夠直接走到沼澤。

content.en: Every fall, baby turtles come from the marsh. Some walk into the shop. They're the size of NT$10 coins. The workers walk very carefully! They pick up the turtles.
content.tw: 每年秋天，烏龜寶寶會從沼澤裡爬出來。牠們只有十元硬幣大，店員都會注意不要踩到。

content.en: The turtles want to go to the pond. But the busy street is bad for baby turtles. Drivers cannot see them. So the workers take them across the street. They put the baby turtles down by the pond.
content.tw: 烏龜寶寶想要穿越馬路，但是這非常危險，所以店員會直接送牠們到池塘旁邊。

content.en: Pond to marsh, marsh to pond: that's what the turtles want. The kind workers help the turtles safely go where they want. Great job, workers! Go, turtles!
content.tw: 從池塘到沼澤，再從沼澤到池塘：這就是烏龜想要的。善良的店員幫助烏龜安全地到達牠們想去的地方。店員們做得好！烏龜加油！

vocabulary.preface: 烏龜過馬路，人類來幫忙。

content.text:
1. pond 池塘
Isn't this a perfect spot for a summer picnic? 這可不是夏日野餐的完美地點?
The pond, the grass, and it's all so quiet.

2. carefully 小心的
Yeah, but what about mosquitoes and the heat? 是沒錯，但是蚊子跟熱氣呢?
It couldn't be that bad. 不會那麼糟的。
I'll plan carefully. 我會有縝密計畫。

3. next to 在旁邊
We can come here in the late afternoon. 我們可以下午晚一點來。
I'll bring bug spray. 我會帶防蚊噴液。
And we can sit next to this big tree.我們可以坐在這棵大樹旁邊。

4. want 想要
Yeah. 對啊!
Oh, I'm so excited! 我好興奮。
I want to invite everyone in my family to the picnic! 我要邀請所有家人來野餐!

vocabulary.postscript:
這些單字很好用，你記住了嗎?
pond池塘
carefully小心的
next to在旁邊
want想要

quiz.question: 1. Where do the female turtles want to go?
2. Where do the baby turtles want to go?
3. Why is the street bad for baby turtles?

content.en: In the UK, there's an elephant called Anne. She worked in a circus. She did circus tricks there.
content.tw: 英國有一頭大象叫做Anne，牠之前在馬戲團表演特技。

content.en: The tricks are not good for elephants. They make the elephants' bodies hurt.
content.tw: 但是這種表演會傷害大象的身體。

content.en: Now Anne lives in a safari park. People drive their cars in safari parks. They look at the animals there. Anne doesn't do circus tricks in this park. Her knees and hips hurt from the circus.
content.tw: Anne現在住在野生動物園裡面，不用再表演特技了。牠的膝蓋跟臀部都會痛。

content.en: A doctor wants Anne to feel better. So every month, he comes to see her. He gives Anne a massage!
content.tw: 有個醫生希望Anne可以好起來，所以他每個月來動物園幫牠按摩。

content.en: This doctor is very good at massages. But elephants are very big and strong! Massaging an elephant is hard work!
content.tw: 這個醫生很會按摩，但大象又大又強壯，幫大象按摩很不容易。

content.en: The massages help Anne. But many other elephants need massages. So now the doctor is a teacher too. He teaches massage - elephant massage! He goes all over the world to teach.
content.tw: 按摩讓Anne好起來，但是還有很多大象也需要幫助。所以這名醫生到世界各地教大家怎麼幫大象按摩。

content.en: His students massage their elephants. After one week, the elephants stand taller. They walk better! The massages help the elephants move!
content.tw: 他的學生也幫他們的大象按摩。按摩讓大象站得更直，也走得更穩!

content.en: The doctor began helping one elephant. Now his massage helps elephants all over the world! What a smart and kind doctor!
content.tw: 這位醫生從幫助一頭大象開始，現在他的按摩幫助了世界各地的大象！真是個聰明又善良的醫生！

vocabulary.preface: 這位充滿愛心的醫生，替大象按摩好減輕牠們的痛苦。

content.text:
1. hurt 痛
Gosh, my knees hurt so much!
From all that running, right?
I only ran 10 kilometers.
It shouldn't be that bad.

2. walk 走路
I guess it's because I also walked three hours.
Walking after running?
That's not smart.

3. feel 感覺
I didn't feel tired at the time.
But now my knees are killing me!

4. better 比較好
Maybe you'd feel better lying down.
Maybe I'd feel better skipping school.

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字你記住了嗎?
hurt痛
walk走路
feel感覺
better比較好

quiz.question: 1. Where does Anne live now?
2. Where does Anne hurt?
3. What is the doctor very good at?

content.en: Barbers cut people's hair. They work in barbershops.
content.tw: 理髮師剪顧客的頭髮。他們在理髮店工作。

content.en: Many people like barbershops. They talk with the barber. They see their friends. They relax and have fun. Oh, and they get a haircut!
content.tw: 很多人喜歡理髮店，可以跟師傅聊天，見見朋友，當然也是為了剪頭髮。

content.en: One day, a teacher went to his barbershop. One of his students came in. But his student didn't have fun. He had nothing to do. He was very bored. He wanted to go!
content.tw: 有一天，一位老師去剪頭髮。他的學生也在那裡。但是這個學生覺得很無聊，想要離開。

content.en: The teacher knew his student. He needed a good book to stop his boredom. Then the teacher had a great idea!
content.tw: 老師知道他的學生需要看書才不會無聊。他想到一個好點子!

content.en: The teacher gave his barbershop many good kids' books. The books were free - and fun! He wanted kids to read at the barbershop. He wanted kids to like reading. And great news! His idea worked very well!
content.tw: 他捐了很多童書給理髮店，希望小朋友可以在理髮店看書，也從此喜歡看書。

content.en: Now he helps over two hundred barbershops! He gives them fun kids' books. The barbers talk with kids about reading too. They ask "Do you like to read?" and "How is that book?" Kids like reading and talking about books there!
content.tw: 現在他幫助了兩百多家理髮店！他為他們提供了有趣的童書。理髮師們也會和小朋友們談論閱讀。他們會問「你喜歡閱讀嗎？」和「那本書怎麼樣？」孩子們喜歡在那裡閱讀和談論書籍！

content.en: That's thousands of kids' reading books, getting a haircut, and having fun!
content.tw: 這代表著成千上萬的孩子在剪頭髮的同時閱讀書籍，並享受樂趣！

vocabulary.preface: 到理髮店剪頭髮，順便看故事書，很棒的主意!

content.text:
1. haircut 剪頭髮
Hey, you got a new haircut! 嘿，你剪了新髮型!
Looks great on you! 很好看呢!
Really? I did it yesterday. 真的喔? 我昨天剪的。
I'm still not sure if I like it. 我還不確定喜不喜歡。

2. bored 厭煩
So you were just bored with your old look? 所以你就是厭煩了老樣子?
Yeah, I got all sweaty with my long hair. 對啊，長頭髮讓我流好多汗。

3. free 免費的
But the best thing is my haircut was free! 最棒的是，我剪頭髮是免費的!
How is that possible? 怎麼可能?
A free haircut in Taipei? 在台北免費剪頭髮?

4. great 很棒的
It's true! 真的啊。Isn't it great? 不是很棒嗎?
I won a gift voucher in a lucky draw.我在幸運抽獎時抽中了禮券。

vocabulary.postscript:
還記得今天學到哪些單字嗎?
haircut剪頭髮
bored厭煩
free免費的
great很棒的

quiz.question: 1. Who works in a barbershop?
2. What did the student need to stop his boredom?
3. How many barbershops is the teacher helping?

content.en: Oh, hello, everyone! Do you like to sing? Do you sing in a group at school? That group is a choir. Taiwan has many great choirs!
content.tw: 你喜歡唱歌嗎？你知道台灣有很多很棒的合唱團嗎？

content.en: The Bao Lai Junior High School Choir is from Kaohsiung. The choir has many indigenous Bunun children. It has students from Jianshan and Laonong Elementary Schools and the Nibun Chorus. There are one hundred twenty students in the choir!
content.tw: 高雄的寶來國中合唱團有120個團員，有尼布恩合唱團的團員，還有建山國小跟荖濃國小的小朋友，他們很多都來自布農族。

content.en: This year, the singers sang one song again and again. They danced that one song again and again. They sang and danced on Saturdays and Sundays. They sang and danced on holidays and hot days.
content.tw: 週末和假日他們都沒有休息，一直練習。

content.en: They sang Pasibutbut. It's a very important Bunun song. It's beautiful. But it's not easy. It's a long song with eight parts. Why did the choir want this song?
content.tw: 布農族的八部合音很優美但不好唱。

content.en: They wanted the world to see a beautiful part of Taiwan!
content.tw: 他們想讓世界看到台灣美麗的一面！

content.en: The choir got on a plane. They went to the World Choir Games. Choirs from forty-six countries came. The Bao Lai Choir sang and danced Pasibutbut there.
content.tw: 合唱團搭上了飛機。他們前往世界合唱大會。來自四十六個國家的合唱團都來了。寶來合唱團在那裡演唱並表演了八部合音。

content.en: The world saw Taiwan. And the choir won a gold medal! Great job, Bao Lai Choir!
content.tw: 世界看到了台灣。合唱團獲得了金牌！寶來合唱團，做得好！

vocabulary.preface: 寶來國中合唱團把悅耳的原住民歌聲，帶到世界各地。

content.text:
1. again and again. 一遍又一遍
Why are you singing the song again and again? 為什麼你一再地唱那首歌?
Oh, was I too loud?

2. song 歌曲
No, I just wondered why you love the song so much.
不會，我只是想知道為什麼你那麼愛那首歌。
Because I'll be joining a singing contest on Sunday.

3. sing 唱歌
So you'll sing in front of people? 所以你在大家面前唱?
Yes, a LOT of people!
對，很多人。
Wow, I can't do that. I'll be so nervous.

4. win 贏得
I believe you will win. 我相信你會贏。
You sing beautifully!
你唱得真美!
Thank you! I hope so.

vocabulary.postscript:
我們來讀單字。
again再一次
song歌曲
sing唱歌
win贏得

quiz.question: 1. Where is the Bao Lai Junior High School Choir from?
2. What did the choir do on Saturdays?
options: c. went to the World Choir Games

quiz.question: 3. How many countries' choirs were at the World Choir Games?

title: A Robot Sweats to Help People

content.en: Oh, it's hot! Hot weather makes us sweat. Sweat comes out on our faces, under our arms, and on our backs. Sweat helps us to cool down. But in very hot weather, we need more help to cool down.
content.tw: 天氣熱的時候，我們會流汗來讓身體降溫。

content.en: But many people don't have air conditioners. Many don't have electric fans. They can't cool down. When they're too hot, they can get very sick.
content.tw: 可是很多人沒有冷氣，也沒有電風扇。他們的身體無法降溫，就會容易生病。

content.en: How do people feel heat in very hot weather? Scientists are studying this. But it's dangerous for people to be too hot. So the scientists made a robot. It breathes! It sweats!
content.tw: 人們天氣熱的時候會感到多熱呢? 科學家也在做研究，他們做了一個機器人，它會呼吸，還會流汗。

content.en: When the weather is hot and dry, hot and wet, or hot and windy, how does the robot feel heat? The scientists can change the robot's settings. Young, older, sick, or healthy - how does it feel heat?
content.tw: 這個機器人還可以切換不同設定，來感受天氣多熱，是不是很乾燥、有沒有風。

content.en: What can we learn from this robot's sweat? We can learn what to do in very hot weather. We can make clothes that keep us cooler. Our cities can learn how to keep people safe.
content.tw: 這個機器人能讓我們知道天氣很熱的時候應該要怎麼做。

content.en: One sweaty robot can help us live safely in a hotter world! Cool!
content.tw: 一個會流汗的機器人能幫助我們在更熱的世界中安全生活！酷！

vocabulary.preface: 能夠感覺到天氣變化的機器人，可以教我們怎麼克服炎熱。

content.text:
1. sweat 流汗
Wow, you're sweating all over! 哇，你滿身大汗!
I am. I walk too fast. 確實，我走太快了。
It's so hot out there! 外面好熱!

2. heat 熱度
Let me turn on the fan for you. 我來替你開電扇。
Thank you! Exactly what I need. 謝謝，正是我需要的。
This heat is killing me! 這種熱氣真要命!

3. change 改變
It's about to change. 天氣就要變了。
Change? A typhoon is coming? 變了? 有颱風要來嗎?
Yeah, the CWB says it will hit Taiwan soon.對，氣象局說很快就會侵襲台灣。

4. dangerous 危險的
But I'm traveling to Taipingshan tomorrow. 但是我明天要上太平山。
Driving on the mountain road will be dangerous. 在山路上開車會危險。

vocabulary.postscript:
Can you remember these words?
sweat流汗
heat熱氣
change改變
dangerous危險的

quiz.question: 1. What kind of weather makes us sweat?
2. What can help people cool down?
3. What can the robot do?

title: Man Takes Little Boat for Big Ride

content.en: It's fun to go to a lake. You can swim or ride in a boat. Some people use kayaks. A kayak is a very small boat. Only one person can use it.
content.tw: 去湖邊玩可以游泳、坐船。有一些人會划獨木舟，kayak這種獨木舟，只能容納一個人。

content.en: Do kayaks go far? No, they usually don't. Most people use them for a few hours.
content.tw: 獨木舟可以划得很遠嗎？ 不會，大多數人只會划幾個小時。

content.en: But one young man likes to go to new places. Zane and his kayak went very, very, VERY far. He used his kayak for many, many, MANY hours. What?!? Zane had a big idea. He wanted to ride his kayak around a lake. He went to one of the biggest lakes in the world, Lake Superior!
content.tw: Zane有個很棒的想法，他想要划著獨木舟繞湖一圈，他去了蘇必略湖，是世界最大湖之一。

content.en: Zane used a paddle to move the kayak. It was hard work. His kayak moved slowly around the lake.
content.tw: 他用槳來划獨木舟，慢慢地繞湖一圈。

content.en: He saw many beautiful things. He saw islands, trees, and many birds and fish.
content.tw: 一路上他看到很多漂亮的風景，島嶼、樹木、還有許多鳥跟魚。

content.en: Zane came back two months later. How far did his kayak go? It went 1,900 kilometers! How many hours did he use his kayak? Hmmm ... 63 days is… about 1,500 hours!
content.tw: Zane兩個月後回來了，Zane坐獨木舟划了多遠呢? 一共划了一千九百公里!一千五百個小時!

content.en: Zane was happy. He went a long way in a little kayak!
content.tw: Zane很高興。他用一艘小獨木舟划了很長的路！

vocabulary.preface: Zane喜歡划船，他花了兩個月的時間划獨木舟。

content.text:
1. month 月。
What's our plan for tomorrow? 我們明天的計劃是什麼?
For your first free day in one month? 你一個月來的第一天自由日嗎?

2. kayak 獨木舟。
Let's go kayaking on Sun Moon Lake. 我們去日月潭划獨木舟吧。
What a wonderful idea! 真棒的主意! That lake is beautiful! 那個湖很美呢!

3. hour 小時。
So we'll kayak for about 3 hours in the morning, and
then….所以我們上午划獨木舟三個鐘頭，然後....
Wait, 3 HOURS? 等一下，三個鐘頭嗎?

4. long 長的。
Why? Is that too long for you? 為什麼? 太長了嗎?
Yeah, I was thinking half an hour. 對啊，我想的是半個鐘頭。
You can't go anywhere in half an hour. 半個鐘頭你哪裡都去不了。

vocabulary.postscript: 我們一起讀今天的單字。month月 kayak獨木舟 hour小時 long長的

title: Kaohsiung Students Build a Car That Runs on Sunlight

content.en: In Australia, there's a race. It's very tough.
content.tw: 澳洲有一場艱難的比賽。

content.en: The drivers drive 3,000 kilometers. They cross a hot desert. Not all cars can do it. Only the toughest cars try.
content.tw: 賽車手要開3000公里跨越炎熱的沙漠，只有最堅固的汽車才有辦法。

content.en: A Taiwanese team is racing this year. They're National Kaohsiung University of Science and Technology students!
content.tw: 台灣有一支團隊會參加今年的比賽。他們是國立高雄科技大學的學生。

content.en: These students want to help change the world. They built a special car. It's called Apollo IX. ("nine")
content.tw: 這些學生想要改變世界。他們打造一台特別的車子，叫做阿波羅九號。

content.en: It's an electric car. That's nothing special, right? Most cars run on gas, but some cars run on electricity. Well, this car has solar panels. It runs on sunlight!
content.tw: 這是一台電動車，並不特別，對不對? 但它可是一台用太陽能發動的車子。

content.en: Apollo IX's hood and roof have solar panels. In sunny weather, they take in sunlight. The solar panels turn sunlight into electricity. The electricity fills the car's battery.
content.tw: 這台車的車頂跟前面的引擎蓋有太陽能板。晴天的時候，它可以吸收陽光轉化成電力。

content.en: The race is a big test for Apollo IX. It can go 518 kilometers with a full battery. But it needs sunlight. The car needs to go 3,000 kilometers! In bad weather, can Apollo IX win the race?
content.tw: 如果天氣不好，阿波羅九號能贏得比賽嗎?

content.en: These students are doing important work. Cars that run on sunlight can change the world. Let's hope they win!
content.tw: 這些學生正在做重要的工作。使用太陽能的汽車可以改變世界。讓我們希望他們贏得比賽！

vocabulary.preface: 台灣學生製造的賽車，是否經得起澳洲沙漠的考驗?

content.text:
1. desert 沙漠
Why would anyone want to drive a car across the desert?
為什麼有人會想開車橫越沙漠?
Why not? 為什麼不呢?
Didn't you want to challenge yourself when you were younger?
難道你年少時沒想過挑戰自己?

2. sunlight 陽光
I did try to stay in bed for 24 hours.我有嘗試躺在床上24小時。
Away from the sunlight.並且遠離陽光。
Wow. That's…uh, that's really something. 那真不簡單。

3. change 改變
It didn't change the world, I know.我知道那沒有改變世界。
But it helped me win a race. 不過有幫我贏得比賽。

4. race 比賽
The race of who can sleep longer? 看誰睡得比較久的比賽?
Yes! How did you know? 對啊，你怎麼知道的?
